ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] hello
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ve had lots of problems with it saying it wouldn t run on Windows NT (bc the software mistakes XP for NT). ... Not wrong, I was logged in with admin
ygData.messageBody:
> "They say that Win2000 is much more stable. XP is also an option. Not
> as stable as 2000 and not compatible with alot of software."
> I've not had any problems with compatible softwares. Compatible mode has
> solved those problems that i used to have. Then again, i don't run any 16
> bit applications.
>
I've had lots of problems with it saying it wouldn't run on Windows NT (bc
the software mistakes XP for NT).
>
> "and you have to go into regedit and edit Permissions to allow yourself to
> install software
> on it. It is a real biyatch sometimes."
> Wrong, use your admin account to install softwares. It's much better
> security to have a regular user account wich you use on regular basis and
> use the admin account when you are installing new softwares. That way it
> will be alot harder for you to fark up your system.
>
Not wrong, I was logged in with admin account and it would not let me
install software. I am the only user of my computer. I even logged in as
admin and it said I did not have the authority to install software. I had to
go into regedit and modify Permissions.
>
> "maybe that info would be at www.tweakui.com?"
> No, it's a reg hack. Altho, WinXX ain't designed to handle very much
memory
> but you can fix it.
>
Yes. Tweak has info on reg hacks to make tweak the systems.
luv,
-Su
